TopicTitle: LIVE NOW: Soil Moisture Active Passive (SMAP) launch on Delta II

Articles.Content:
http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/nasatv/index.html#.VMozly4Xvf0

Launch is at 9:20 ET

launch scrubbed - delayed for 24h

- from what i heard, the scrub was due to high altitude winds.

Well, at least the rocket will be extra clean!

(get it, get it?)

launch scrubbed - delayed for 24h

- from what i heard, the scrub was due to high altitude winds.

Good, I over slept and would have missed it.

Now I just need to find my tripod for tomorrow and hope for no coastal fog.
Launch now expected no earlier than Saturday at 9:20:42 AM EST.
T-2 hours and counting!

I found this video of how it's antenna unfolds and scans, it's a pretty unusual layout.

I think I read that it takes two days to unfold everything.

Edited January 31, 2015 by Tommygun

T-10 minutes and counting. SMAP & NASA are GO, weather is still RED due to high winds, but new data could clear the Delta II rocket for liftoff. New launch time is now 14:22 UTC, 9:22 am EST.

- - - Updated - - -

Winds are now green, control team is GO for launch at 9:22!

- - - Updated - - -

Liftoff!! Mach 1.
Nice to see the Delta II flying again, thought it had been retired.
I tuned in within the last minute. It was a pretty underwhelming launch though, but nice to see anyway.
Yes, nothing too spectacular (it vanished through the clouds something like 10 seconds after liftoff ) but my first Atlas II launch, so for me it was kinda special. I love its "vintage" look.

This photo brought to you by coastal morning clouds.......

Seventy percent of the sky was clear except the part over Vandenberg launch area. Ugh.

Well I wasn't the only one up early to watch. There was a surprisingly large owl watching and an unknown number of hungry coyotes in the nearby brush.

but my first Atlas II launch, so for me it was kinda special. I love its "vintage" look.

I hate to burst your bubble, since you are so enthousiastic, but it is a Delta II. The shape is still pretty nice, though.

Edited January 31, 2015 by Camacha

I hate to burst your bubble, since you are so enthousiastic, but it is a Delta II. The shape is still pretty nice, though.

No problem, I actually meant to type Delta II, not Atlas II Either way, thanks!

I've caught this now. Click for larger screenshots.

I've never seen solar panels opening live. It was quite fast.

I saw it this morning from where I live near Oxnard. It was amazing. The sky was COMPLETELY clear and there wasn't a single cloud in the sky. It started out as a relatively long fireball that ascended and expanded, which turned into a small red dot when the 3 SRBs burned out. Then something awesome happened: the first stage started making this contrail:

What was cool about it was that it got larger as the vehicle ascended and immediately cut out at MECO. Here's a picture a few minutes later:

And one by my friend:

It was great.

No problem, I actually meant to type Delta II, not Atlas II Either way, thanks!

It's very much less cool. A little less longevity.

Still, you lucky little **** in the US to get snaps of rocket contrails.

Thatcher ensured I couldn't. What I would give to even see its trail.

I saw it this morning from where I live near Oxnard. It was amazing. The sky was COMPLETELY clear and there wasn't a single cloud in the sky. It started out as a relatively long fireball that ascended and expanded, which turned into a small red dot when the 3 SRBs burned out. Then something awesome happened: the first stage started making this contrail:

http://i.imgur.com/oOtgDrr.jpg

What was cool about it was that it got larger as the vehicle ascended and immediately cut out at MECO. Here's a picture a few minutes later:

And one by my friend:

It was great.

Nice shot. Careful though, out there in CA you'll have them all screaming about Chemtrails.

I'm sorry to revive a dead thread, but I just wanted to give a mission update: SMAP's radar instrument has been hit by an anomaly.

Press release
Another one? What is going on in the space? Glitches all over O.o Kraken took a residence somewhere, attracted by growing amounts of space junk we are producing?

Another one? What is going on in the space? Glitches all over O.o Kraken took a residence somewhere, attracted by growing amounts of space junk we are producing?

I know, that's exactly what I thought! Either that or they're much more comfortable than before at announcing glitches and such.
